welcome.title: Mood Detective
welcome.subtitle: Can a computer read feelings? Join Detective Luna to find out!

luna.name: Detective Luna
luna.description: A friendly detective who loves solving mood mysteries!
dialogue: Hi there! I'm Detective Luna, and I'm here to help you understand how computers can read feelings!
Did you know that computers can look at words and figure out if someone is happy, sad, or angry?
It's like being a detective, but instead of looking for clues, we look for mood words!
Ready to become a mood detective with me?

tom.name: Tom
tom.description: Always cheerful and ready to share positive vibes!
dialogue: Hey! I'm Tom, and I love finding happy words everywhere!
Words like 'awesome', 'fantastic', and 'love' make me smile!
Can you spot the happy words in sentences?

maya.name: Maya
maya.description: Calm and wise, helps understand neutral feelings.
dialogue: Hello! I'm Maya. Sometimes feelings aren't just happy or sad.
Some sentences are neutral - they don't show strong emotions.
It's important to recognize when someone is just sharing information.

rex.name: Rex
rex.description: Helps identify sad and angry feelings with care.
dialogue: Hi! I'm Rex, and I help understand all kinds of feelings.
Sometimes people feel sad or angry, and that's okay!
Words like 'upset', 'angry', or 'sad' help us understand these feelings.

intro: I'm Detective Luna, and I'm here to teach you how computers understand feelings.
Just like detectives look for clues, we look for special words that tell us about moods.
Are you ready to become a mood detective?
howItWorks: Computers read each word in a sentence.
They look for happy words like 'love' and 'awesome'.
They also find sad words like 'sad' and 'upset'.
Then they decide what mood the sentence shows!
challenge: I'll show you sentences, and you'll guess the mood.
Drag each sentence to the right mood basket.
Let's see how good you are at reading feelings!

happy: This is the best day ever!
I'm so excited about the party!
I got an A on my test!
This game is so much fun!
I love playing with my friends!
The weather is perfect for a picnic!
neutral: The book is on the table.

game.instructions: Drag each sentence to the mood basket that matches how it feels!

mlPeek.title: How Computers Think
mlPeek.subtitle: See how different methods analyze the same sentence
mlPeek.explanation: Both methods look at the same words but think about them differently!
